snippet: The arrests of a Washington Post journalist and his wife, a fellow journalist, offer proof that the country remains harshly committed to repression.
abstract: Editorial decries arrests of Washington Post correspondent Jason Rezaian and his wife and fellow journalist Yeganeh Salehi in Iran; argues that incident shows that country's oppression of journalism is continuing unabated despite talk of thaw by Pres Hassan Rouhani; calls on Rouhani to release them.
lead_paragraph: The arrests of a Washington Post journalist and his wife, a fellow journalist, offer proof that the country remains harshly committed to repression.
